cards.back: h_ie (input impedance), h_re (reverse voltage ratio ≈ 0), h_fe (current gain = β), h_oe (output admittance = 1/r_o).
V₁ = h_ie·I₁ + h_re·V₂. I₂ = h_fe·I₁ + h_oe·V₂. First equation: input loop. Second: output loop.
For parallel-connected two-ports: Y_total = Y₁ + Y₂. All parameters in Siemens.
For series-connected two-ports: Z_total = Z₁ + Z₂. All parameters in Ohms.
For cascaded stages: ABCD_total = ABCD₁ × ABCD₂. Matrix multiplication gives overall response.
Second letter = common terminal: "e" for CE, "b" for CB, "c" for CC. Example: h_fe = β for CE.
Output admittance with input open = 1/r_o. Due to Early effect: I_C depends slightly on V_CE.
Stage 1 output impedance and Stage 2 input impedance form a divider. Actual gain = A_V1 × (R_in2/(R_in2+R_out1)) × A_V2.
h_ie = r_π = β/g_m. For β=100, I_C=1mA: h_ie = 100/40mS = 2.5kΩ.
